highlights

Power sector emissions declines by 1.2%.

Change in energy related CO2 emissions by region - 2018-2019

Global power sector emissions declined by some 170 Mt, or 1.2%, with the biggest falls taking place in advanced economies where CO2 emissions are now at levels not seen since the late 1980s (when electricity demand was one-third lower).

Global CO2 emissions from coal use declined from 2018.

About Climate Trace

Our vision

We make meaningful climate action faster and easier by mobilizing the global tech community to track greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions with unprecedented detail and speed.

Our members

methodology

Climate Trace aims to achieve daily emissions for every square km of Earth’s surface. As a coalition, we gather satellite, ground truth and alternative data sources to maintain verified, high-coverage measurements of atmospheric carbon. Read More
